extendedIngredients.name: cabbage
extendedIngredients.original: 1 head cabbage, cored and coarsely chopped

title: Southern Fried Cabbage
summary: You can never have too many Southern recipes, so give Southern Fried Cabbage a try. One serving contains 229 calories, 8g of protein, and 16g of fat. For 85 cents per serving, you get a side dish that serves 4. Head to the store and pick up bacon, cabbage, sugar, and a few other things to make it today. 21 person have made this recipe and would make it again. It is brought to you by Allrecipes. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, dairy free, and fodmap friendly diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 35 minutes. Taking all factors into account, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 74%, which is solid. Similar recipes include Southern Fried Cabbage, Southern Bacon-Fried Cabbage, and Cabbage Thoran (Kerala Style Stir-Fried Cabbage).

winePairing.pairingText: Riesling, Sparkling Wine, and Zinfandel are my top picks for Southern. In general, there are a few rules that will help you pair wine with southern food. Food-friendly riesling or sparkling white wine will work with many fried foods, while zinfandel is great with barbecued fare. The Maximin Grunhaus Abtsberg Riesling Kabinett with a 4.1 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 42 dollars per bottle.
